author: travelandtourworld.com
title: Malaysia’s tourism sector 6th largest contributor to nation’s economyTravelandtourworld.com
text:
Malaysia’s tourism sector 6th largest contributor to nation’s economy Published on : Saturday, October 17, 2015
Malaysia’s tourism sector is the sixth largest contributor to the country’s Gross Domestic Product contributing significantly towards Malaysia’s economy since the inception of the National Transformation Programme (NTP), said Prime Minister Najib Razak.
The Asian countries tourism sector contributed a total of RM161 billion or 14.9 percent of the nation’s gross domestic product (GDP) in 2014.
Malaysia attracted 27.44 million tourists with RM72 billion in tourist receipts despite ‘a year of tragedies that saw the whole world grieve with us’, said the Premier.
In his blog NajibRazak.Com he writes, “However, the impact of tourism goes beyond tourist arrivals or tourist receipts, its impact is most important on the sustainable development of our economy and society.”
“One billion tourists, one billion opportunities, the theme of this year’s World Tourism Day, celebrated recently on September 27, strikes a resonance to Malaysia’s journey towards 2020,” he said.
In turn, tourism had benefited Malaysians directly. In 2014, the industry attracted RM19.4 billion of investment, more impressively, it had contributed a total of 1.77 million jobs (13 percent of total employment), Najib said.
